keyword: how many calories in a brownie
title: How Many Calories Are in a Brownie?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a brownie, including carbs, fat, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Brownie?
assumptions: Standard chocolate brownie, ~50 g, fudgy texture, baked from scratch or store-bought, no nuts or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, size, brand, ingredients like chocolate type, and add-ins. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard brownie contains about 250 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a brownie?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard 50 g chocolate brownie.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a brownie?
faqs.a: About 35 g total carbs, including 25 g sugars and 1 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a brownie high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 12 g fat per brownie, with 5 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does brownie size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger brownies (e.g., 100 g) can double to 500 kcal; smaller ones are lower.
Yes, using avocado or black beans for fat/protein can reduce calories by 20-50 while keeping flavor.
